intro: Iguanura wallichiana subsp. malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
